{"result":["[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=93\nPages: 93\nThe effect of adding Pythagorean musical ratios to Maier's alchemical\nimagery was that it transformed them into theurgical talismans . Just as\nDee's and Khunrath's use of Pythagorean geometry was a means ofcapturing the astral forces in their theurgic sigils, in the same way, Maier's\nPythagorean music attracted the celestial powers into his emblems, turning them into magical instruments. In particular, the fifth interval, representing the solar rays and the philosopher's stone, magnetically attracted\nthe sun, introducing a potent theurgic charge into the alchemical procedure. (This motif may have even been a reference to the process of\ndistillation by the heat of the sun). Reinforced by the music, Maier's\nemblems were intended to become transmutatory instruments of the\nsame type as the catoptrical mirrors described by John Dee in the Monas\nHieroglyphica and the \"annuli\" pictured by Khunrath in the Amphiteatrum.\nIn these ideas, Maier could have been influenced by a reference in the]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=77\nPages: 77\nthe Propaedeumata Aphoristica and to the theurgic cypher of the Monas\nHieroglyphica. Dee's account of \"zographie\" in the Mathematicall Preface\nimplied that a graphic system based on Pythagorean geometry would act\nas a theurgic talisman absorbing the celestial virtues. Dee's theories\nwould resonate with Khunrath's own Agrippan influences, as well as with\nhis Paracelsian theosophy in which Christ-Anthropos operated through\nthe light of\"Hochmah\" to pervade the universe. Khunrath's engravings\nwere, thus, spiritual catoptrical mirrors, reflecting the light of Eternal\nWisdom to the mind of the viewer.\nAccording to Szonyi, architectural motifs in mystical imagery are cosmograms in which the buildings and their ground-plans signify the construction of the cosmos, producing a revelation in the viewer's mind'\nconcerning the fabric of reality. Szonyi has, however, distinguished such\ncosmograms from the use of similar architectural motifs in alchemical]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=30\nPages: 30\nwell as by the earlier Orphic poems, Ficino in De Triplici Vitae (1489)\ndeveloped talismanic and magical rituals invoking the beneficial attributes of the sun, stars and planets. The recent research of Michael\nAllen into Ficino's Pythagorean numerology has revealed his interest in\noptical geometry as a theurgic device, enabling the spirit of the magus to\nact as a mirror of the \"idola\" flowing from animate and inanimate objects. Effectively, the mental planes of the magus, like mirror-surfaces,\nwere programmed by geometrical formulae corresponding to the various\nastral forces. Szonyi in his study of John Dee's Monas Hieroglyphica has\nconcluded that Ficino's theurgy was as significant in its influence on\nDee's magical practices as were medieval scholastic sources.22\nSince the ancient imagery ofthe sun had already acquired a Christian\nmeaning by this period, therefore, Ficino's magical operations involving]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=79\nPages: 79\ndisplays geometrical symbols, with an upright pentacle in a circle on the\nleft-page and, opposite it, an image ofthe squaring ofthe circle on which\nappears the word \"Time\" and the Tetragrammaton. The appearance of\nthe pentacle is somewhat puzzling in view of Khunrath's diatribe in the\n1595 Amphiteatrum against black magicians who used this sign instead of\nthe truly Christian \"annulus \" (of the \"Archetypos\").\nThis is explained by examining Agrippa's description of theurgical\nsigils in De Occulta Philosophia. Agrippa used the geometrical form of the\npentacle in his account ofthe harmonic relations between the macrocosm\nand the human body.42 This image, nonetheless , was not the only \"pentacle\" desribed by Agrippa who also published the work of Peter ofAbano on magical sigils and the rituals associated with them. In the fourth\nbook ofthis treatise, Abano describes the rites associated with the \"pentacle\". Agrippa illustrates this device which, it turns out, does not have]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=96\nPages: 96,97\napex in heaven (signified by the vanishing-point), represents the quest for\nthe philosopher's stone by means of celestial alchemy. Even more significantly, Maier's emblem like that of de Vries in the Amphiteatrum is an\nalchemical sigil, a catoptrical mirror reflecting the light of the quintessence. It is, in itself, a theurgical instrument whose potency is amplified\nbyMaier's Pythagorean musical score whose motif of the diapentic interval as the golden apple ofAtalanta, introduces the power ofthe solar rays\ninto the process of alchemical transmutation.\n45 Shumaker, pp. 136-38, 148-51.\n46 Maier (1618), p. 42: \"Sic foetui humanam vitam vegetabili (qua solam in utero\nmatris fruebatur) defuncto, alia perfectior per transitum in hanc lucem mundanam sive\nper nativitatem accedit. Imo et nobis hac praesenti vitam, quam agimus, alia\nperfectissima et aeterna imminet\".\nCHAPTER TWELVE\nROBERT FLUDD:\nTHE DIVINE ALCHEMY OF THE EYE OF GOD]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=52\nPages: 52\nhuman-being had both a physical and an astral body, but that his real\nbody was astral. It was by means of the imagination located in the astral\nbodythat a person could attain to \"gnosis\" and, thereby, learn to control\nphysical manifestation through the \"astra\" present within all things.\nThus, for the Paracelsian magus it was sufficient to contemplate an object, instead of manipulating it physically. Visual imagery, such as talismanic cyphers or alchemical pictures, provided a stimulus to the imagination of the magus and acted as simulacra of the objects under his\ncontrol.\nDee's view of the theurgic function of Pythagorean-based drawing\nmay explain two particular alchemical images which Yates stated that she\nfound incomprehensible. The alchemical image which specifically puzzled her was Emblem VIII from Maier's Atalanta Fugiens (1617) (fig. 41).\nHer attribution of a conceptual influence on Maier from Dee in this\ncontext is accurate, but she did not connect Emblem VIII specifically to]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=75\nPages: 75,76\n152.\nand Zeller,\n28 Klossowski de Rola, The Golden Game (1988), pp. 43-44. See Peuckert\n. Samtliche Schriften, 4, pp. 7ff, 133-51, 320-22, esp. Ch. 3 on \"Christus\nWeigel\nValentin\ncrucifixus\".\n29 Klossowski de Rola, The Golden Game (1988), p. 44.\n123\nCHAPTER NINE\nAMPHITEATRUM SAPIENTIAE AETERNAE. THE EDITION OF 1604\nthe words \"Christo inductus et eum imitans\" (\"led by Christ and imitating him\"). On the outer circle of the diagram there is another reference\nto the resurrected, triunary \"Xptotoo crucifixus\" who sits on the throne\n(of God) and who leads the soul to the Truth.30 It will be recalled that in\nthe manuscript copy of the 1595 Amphiteatrum (MS Alnwick 571) Khunrath had chastised the black magicians for their use of the pentacle,\nstating that the \"annulus\" (Agrippa's term for a magical talisman) is the\nlegitimate cabbalistic cypher. It is probable that by these words Khunrath\nwas indicating the theurgic authority of the circular engraving of the]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=33\nPages: 33\nthere45 are traces of the talismanic magic of Ficino, Agrippa and Paracelsus.\nAphorism XXVI\nThe stars and celestial powers are like seals whose characters are imprinted\ndifferently by reason of differences in the elemental matter. In the same way,\nthe engraved forms ofour seals are imprinted more easily upon one material\nthan upon another ... You will therefore consider talismans rather attentively, and other still greater things.46\nDee also refers to the powerful esoteric practice ofpyromancy, the art of\nfire, in alchemy.\nAphorism II\nwonderful changes may be produced by us in natural things by means ofthe\nprinciples of pyronomia.47\nPyrologians (alchemists) are mentioned again in another section whose\nobstetrical character recalls Paracelsus' alchemical cosmogony in Philosophia ad Athenienses. Dee speaks of the \"four separate great wombs ofthe\nworld\" (air, fire, water, earth) which are constituted of \"three separate]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=87\nPages: 87\nthe pietistic atmospheric ofKhunrath's treatises could not be more different from the obsessive manipulations of Studion's cabbalistic cryptography. In fact, Studion's graphic structures, as well as those ofTobias Hess,\nare related to the theurgic emblems of Peter of Abano and other medieval necromancers publicised by Agrippa. These may, in fact, have been\nthe \"pentacles\" denounced by Khunrath in the 1595 Amphiteatrum for\ntheir anti-Christian connotations, while pronouncing his own \"annulus\"\nof Christ as the \"azoth\" to be the true cabblistic insignia. Such differences in the interpretation of cabbalism and Paracelsian theosophy by different German philosophers raise the question, discussed by Stoeffler, concerning the exact role of hermeticism in the history of religious\nreformism.21 Certainly, the ideological position ofStudion and hiscollaborator, Tobias Hess, in their jointly-authored Prophetica is ofa different\norderfrom that ofWeigel, Arndt or Khunrath. Studion and Hess seem to]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=81\nPages: 81\ntheurgic device, since it was based on Euclidean optical models and on\nPythagorean mystic geometry. Relating the proportional ratios underlying geometrical drawing to the mystical numerology of Pythagoras, Dee\nhad implied that this type of drawing (\" zographie\") produced a theurgic\nmirror which catoptrically reflected the divine qualities ofthe heavens to\nthe viewer. In addition, Dee had stressed the intellectual and spiritual\nvalues ofVitruvian architecture, such as the classical elements and spatial\nproportions which are shown in de Vries' picture. The whole hall-way, in\nfact, symbolises a cone of light-rays whose apex lies in the eye of God.\nThe picture is, thus, a reflection of God's divine vision, becoming a\ntheurgic mirror of enormous power which, rightly used, could effect spiritual and material transmutations.\nThis optical aspect of the illustration may be signified by its circular]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=82\nPages: 82,83\nhuman imagination to be an astral force, capable of theurgically manipulating the world of time and space. Hence, the prime function of de\nVries' engraving was to validate Khunrath's cabbalistic Christological\nalchemy.\nThere are two other pictures in Khunrath's iconographic repertoire\nwhich similarly provide a rhetorical defence of his position as a spiritual\nalchemist against the rising tide of objections to his theosophical Christology. These are the Magdeburg emblem of an owl and the 1602 image of\nthe \"calumniatores\".\n136\n52 Jung's drawing in Bibliotek Kopenhagen, MS GKS 1765 may be seen in thereproduction in Gilly, Cimelia Rhodostaurotica (1995), p. 14, Item 12b.\n137\n53 Henry Moore Institute, Leeds, Peter Scheemakers: \"The Famous Statuary\" (1691-1781),\n1966, exhibition catalogue, No. 6, Vue d'Optique engraving, c. 1750, with mahogany\nand glass viewing machine.\n54 Obrist, pp. 55-65, 248-49.\nCHAPTER TEN\nEPICUREANS, BLASPHEMERS, SOPHISTS AND\nBLACK-MAGICIANS: THE PERSECUTION OF]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=96\nPages: 96\npurified by fire, they will arise in the perfected form of the philosopher's\nstone. Hence, in Emblem VIII, the perspectival grid signifies the divine\nlight of the heavens, the alchemical quintessence which carries the seed\nof gold from the sun. It is placed directly above the egg to denote the\npotential evolution of prime matter to a higher spiritual condition.\nTherefore, the theurgic meaning of Emblem VIII lies within a set of\nassociations inter- relating Vitruvian architecture, perspectival geometry\nand catoptrics, in short, the same themes explored by Dee. Consequently,\nMaier's emblem, like that of Khunrath, explains the theory of an alchemy of light. The diagrammatic tunnel of orthogonal lines, like de Vries'\nhallway, refers to Paracelsian astral influences and Dee's astrological catoptrics. This geometrical structure, with its base on the earth and its\napex in heaven (signified by the vanishing-point), represents the quest for]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=9\nPages: 9\nand theurgical ritual. Indeed, late Renaissance alchemists developed a\nconceptual structure which could be called an \"alchemy oflight\", a syncretic philosophy integrating the discrete intellectual and mystical currents of Pythagorean geometry, neoplatonism, medieval optics, Paracelsian alchemy and cabbalism.\nThe concept of the divinity of light had been transmitted from the\nmost ancient times to the late hellenistic philosopher Plotinus, as well as\nto various gnostic and hermetic groups, such as those connected with the\ntheosophical writings known to the Renaissance as the Pymander of\nHermes Trismegistus. In origins the term \"hermeticism\" referred to the\nlate hellenistic teachings ofTrismegistus and his followers, such as Asclepius. This theosophical system had emerged by the second century BC in\nEgypt, but at first it did not include alchemy which developed only during the first Christian centuries, alchemical literature being added to the]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=86\nPages: 86\nCHAPTER TEN\nEPICUREANS, BLASPHEMERS, SOPHISTS AND BLACK-MAGICIANS\nciples, while in the lower level there appear a lion and a dragon, the\nlatter being the alchemical Ouroboros (\"ego draco sapientum\"). Thetext\non his heraldic shield explains his significance as a hieroglyph ofthe spirit\nof the most wise and secret world by which the cosmos is animated and\nconserved. The lion also bears a shield which explains that he is the Salt\nofWisdom and the alchemical Magnesia. A stream of water issues from\nthe cave across a text on the ground which pronounces Khunrath's philosophical convictions to be of the highest natural and moral rectitude,\ntestified by the conscience, born of sane reasoning, according to Christian doctrine.10 The texts around the cave, as well as those on the left and\nright-hand sides of the engraving, cite Seneca, Gratus, Hieronymous]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=17\nPages: 17\nprogrammes since they are designed to hold the viewer's attention for a\nprolonged period of time. Earlier alchemical imagery, even that ofSalomon Trismosin, is basically a short-hand symbolic system, illustrating,\nabbreviating and decorating the accompanying text. It is designed to\nclarify and to deliver information as quickly (and pleasurably) as possible.\nParacelsus had awarded the human imagination a structural role in\nhis theurgy and, thereby, in his cosmology. He had taught that the human-being, as a mirror ofthe cosmic order, had two bodies, one ofwhich\nwas physical and the other astral. He considered that the imagination\nwas a faculty ofthe astral body whose function was related to intellectual\nand spiritual cognition. It was only due to the existence of the celestial\nspheres within the human body as its innate \"astra\" that the humanbeing could understand the stars. Moreover, since the stars generated all\nearthly phenomena, therefore , through the \"astra\" it was possible for]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=80\nPages: 80\nAbano's rituals and entering the grounds of superstition and demonology.\nThe critical factor for Khunrath would always have been the presence or\nabsence ofChrist in a theurgy whose purpose was to intensify the Christian experience of the Holy Spirit, thus healing both the soul and the\nbody. For his own pentacle, or \"annulus\", Khunrath was using the form\nof Agrippa's cosmically-harmonised man, which Khunrath expanded\ninto the image of cosmic \"Anthropos\", or Christ as the \"anima mundi\",\nthe soul pervading the universe. The pentacle in this case would refer by\nits numerology to the alchemical \"azoth\", which in Khunrath's Weigelian theosophy is also Christ.\nThe pentacle is placed opposite another geometrical image expressing\nthe same pietistic Christology, that ofthe squaring ofthe circle. Since the\nresolution ofthis Pythagorean problem could only be a superhuman feat,\nhence in the context of Khunrath's theosophy it becomes an icon ofthe]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=104\nPages: 104\nof cosmic and human existence was to balance the oppositions within\ninternal and external nature and to unite them with the Eternal Light.59\nGichtels' mystical emblems signify the spiritual alchemy initiated by\nthe inner inspiration of the Word, Christ and the dawning of the light\nbrought by his incarnation within the individual soul. A frequent symbol\nin these images is that of the eye of God, sometimes profusely inscribed\non the \"wheels\" of the Ezekiel's Chariot (the cabbalistic \"Merkebah\").60\nGichtel inter-related Ezekiel's symbols into those of Christian iconography, such as the dove of the Holy Spirit, the sacred name and form of\nChrist, the emblem of the sacred heart, the equilateral triangle of the\nHoly Trinity and a profusion of the eyes of God, often containing the\nTetragrammaton. These are set within the aurora of the divine light of\nthe Son of God who in Boehme's Aurora (1612) replenished the world\nafter its corruption by the fall of Lucifer from grace.]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=76\nPages: 76\nwas indicating the theurgic authority of the circular engraving of the\n\"Archetypos\" which was derived from the risen Christ.31\nThe same Christian intention ofbelittling the practices ofblackmagic\nis encountered in one of the engravings made for the Amphiteatrum in\n1602, that of a circular fortress with twenty-one gates (fig. 29). The concept promoted in this image is that Christ, as the illuminating principle of\nnature in the philosopher's stone, is the only path to the kingdom ofGod.\nThe texts in the centre of the castle refer to the light of nature and the\nhealing powers of Christ as the universal Salt, the philosopher's stone and\nthe water of life. He is to be attained by spagyric and orthodox philosophical principles. Sophistry will not prevail against them.32 In contrast,\nthe texts around the fortress denounce black magical practices, false alchemical principles and sophistry, that is, theurgy without a Christian]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=46\nPages: 46\nmanner in which the magus could turn his own spirit into a theurgical\n\"mirror\", through the esoteric application of optical geometry and Pythagorean ratios.33 As Dee explained in the introduction to the Monas\nHieroglyphica,\nthe optician will confound the stupidity of his art; he had worked in all\nmanner of ways to shape a mirror into the parabolic line of a (suitably\nrotated) conical section, so as to attack any matter (liable to fire) with that\nincredible heat (issuing) from the rays of the Sun; yet here a line is revealed\nas resulting from a trigonal section of the tetrahedron after whose shape,\nwhen rendered three-dimensional, a mirror may be formed which ... can\nreduce any stones or any metal to, as it were, impalpable powders by the\nforce of ... heat.34\n28 Josten, pp. 194-95.\n29 Linda Fierze-David, The Dream ofPoliphilo (New York: Pantheon, 1950).\n30 Alexander Turner Cory, The Hieroglyphics of Horapollo Nilous (London: William\nPickering, 1840).]","[url_for_citation: https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=136\nPages: 136\ntrine of signatures, xiv, 45-46; Expositio\nMichelspacher, Stefan, xxi, 5 , 7, 40, 69, 76,\nmagicarumfigurarum, 45; imagination, 7-8,\n99-101, 181\n61, 77, 114; light ofnature, 8, 43; mediMithras, 31-32\ncal theory, 15, 42-45, 51-53, 95; nitre\nMoffett, Thomas, 48\n(saltpetre), 24, 46-48, 52, 93; Paragranum,\n42, 98; Philosophia ad Athenienses, 41;\nMoller, Johannes, 83\n, xix-xx, 80, 82,\nMontgomery,JohnWarwick\nPhilosophia Magna, 43; theosophy, xix, 784, 146\n8, 41, 43, 55, 77, 83, 84, 183; theurgy,\n38 , 42, 45-46, 49 , 55, 77, 97; Volumen\nmoon, 14, 25, 62-63, 66, 160, 178\nmedicinae, 45\nMorhof, Georg, 83\nParacelsian influences on alchemical illusMorienus, 96\nmusic(alchemical), 21-22, 130, 133, 156-59, tration, 5-9, 61, 77, see Fludd, Khunrath\n165, 172, 173, 174, see Boethius, Pytha- (illustrations)\nPecham, John, 29, 35, 36\ngoreani\nPeirce, Charles Sanders, xvi, xvii, 1-3, 4\nMylius ,Johann, 20, 69, 174, 179\nPenotus, 99\nMythologiae Christianae, see Andreae]"]}
ChatGPT
In *"The Alchemy of Light,"* theurgical talismans are discussed in the context of Pythagorean geometry and alchemical imagery, particularly in the works of Michael Maier. These talismans were designed to harness celestial and spiritual powers through the integration of music, geometry, and symbolism. Here are key points: 1. Transformation into Theurgical Talismans: By adding Pythagorean musical ratios to his alchemical imagery, Maier transformed his emblems into theurgical talismans. This process was intended to capture celestial powers and introduce a potent spiritual charge into alchemical operations. The fifth musical interval, symbolizing the suns rays and the philosophers stone, is highlighted for its ability to magnetically attract the sun's influence: > "Maier's Pythagorean music attracted the celestial powers into his emblems, turning them into magical instruments." [Urszula Szul, page 93](https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=93). 2. Catoptrical Mirrors and Theurgical Devices: These talismans were not purely symbolic; they functioned as theurgical devices, similar to John Dees catoptrical mirrors, reflecting divine qualities and aiding in spiritual and material transmutations. The combination of musical and geometrical elements in these emblems acted as a conduit for celestial forces: > "Reinforced by the music, Maier's emblems were intended to become transmutatory instruments of the same type as the catoptrical mirrors described by John Dee." [Urszula Szul, page 93](https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=93). This synthesis of music, geometry, and alchemical symbolism positioned Maiers works as powerful theurgical talismans, intended to attract and channel divine energy for alchemical and spiritual transformation. For more details, you can refer to [page 93](https://myaidrive.com/hs65vjuNRbfJrJRj9xCPd3/Urszula-Szul.pdf?pdfPage=93).
